text: I have a secret to share with you and
now it's not going to be a secret
anymore you don't have to spend 25
minutes standing over the stove to make
delicious risotto today's recipe is an
oven risotto you want to start off with
about a quarter cup of minced onions I
like to make my onion really fine for
risotto because I want it to basically
dissolve in there I don't want big
pieces of onion in my risotto I just
don't like that texture very much but
you definitely want the flavor of
pungent from here on out super simple
heat a little bit of olive oil in a
small saucepan add your onion cook it
till it's translucent we take too long a
couple minutes onions are translucent
add 3/4 of a cup of arborio rice if you
can get your hands on carnaroli or viola
nanano those are other fantastic if a
little bit fancier risotto Rice's they
all work really well here stir it around
make sure that the fat in the pan is
coating the rice then add a quarter cup
of white wine and then let it reduce
basically what you want is for the pan
to be dry doesn't take very long with a
quarter cup of wine add some salt about
three-quarters of a teaspoon and some
pepper want to make sure that you season
at this stage because as the rice
absorbs the liquid that's when the
flavor gets infused in there if you wait
till the end to season it'll be too late
1/2 a cup of chicken broth
and one and a half cups of water if you
wanted to use more chicken broth you
could if you wanted to use a veg
rafi hood it's kind of up to you now you
want to bring this to a boil so it's
coming to a boil give it a cover put it
into a 425 degree oven until all the
liquid is absorbed and the rice is like
99% it'll take about 20 to 25 minutes
it's super hot when it comes out of the
oven so what I like to do is keep my pot
holder over the handle so I don't
accidentally touch it
uncover all the liquid has been absorbed
and now you just add the finishing
touches you add some Parmesan cheese 1/4
cup of grated parm a tablespoon or more
of unsalted butter stir it in and then
to finish your risotto off and make it
as creamy and delicious as stove top
version what you want to do is add some
hot liquid you can use water or stock or
a combination of the two I'm using just
stock add about a quarter cup to start
and you could add up to three-quarters
of a cup depending on how creamy you
want it it's turning creamy its falling
onto itself exactly the way a risotto
should it's actually kind of amazing I
think it's a great method all the grains
of rice are surrounded by a little bit
of liquid to sort of settle in themself
which is exactly what you're looking for
in a classic risotto spoon sama
you can adapt it to include all kinds of
delicious toppings like shrimp or
asparagus or peas some cooked shrimp to
make this Romeo or serve just this way a
little bit of parsley on top
about some freshly grated firm just to
finish off you don't have to but it is a
nice touch and just like that you have
risotto straight from the oven to your
table
